column5: http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/toronto/lake-ontario-search-1.3632211 regrets go out to the families guys and girls pay attention to conditions you wont win   SAFETY FIRST SAFETY LAST SAFETY ALWAYS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
What a terrible shame, my sympathy to the families.
On Lake O with a tin boat yesterday?????
4 M boat in those conditions.  mt thoughts exactly, stubborn old guys, one their 50's other in their 70's should have known much better than to go out in 3-4 ft waves in a 12ft boat.
If winds are over 20 km/h I'll stay off lake O.  That's in a 18'  deep V . A 14' tinner in those conditions is plain crazy. Sad they had to pay the ultimate price for it though.
